moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. e3 Nf6 4. Bxc4 e6: it seems that changing night is better because if not, black get a powerful game on the queenside.
moves.12. Ne4 Na5 13. Ba2 Nb4 14. Bb1 Nb3: two strong nights. back only needs to be careful from the b1-h7 diagonal
18. Qc2 is worth consideration, for example:
18. Qc2 g6 (a must...) 19. Ne5 Bb7 20. Rh3 etc.
moves.18... Bb7 19. Qg4 f5: white sacrifices a Knight in order to take the Bishop on b7 later. meanwhile, he is destroying the King's defence...
moves.20. Qf3 fxe4 21. Qxe4 Rf5 22. g4 Nf4:
!
the White king is open for attack!
all white's peices are at the wrong side of the board.
moves.23. Qxb7 Rxe5:
a must!
taking the last defender is a must!
material is no longer a matter...
moves.24. dxe5 Ne2+ 25. Kf1 Nxc1 26. Rc3 Rb8 2:

the game here is already finished.
